review_blob:
Aroma: Initial scents of hops. followed by citrus
Appearance: Pours a golden colour, with a decent white head
Taste: For a pils, is fairly hoppy and medium to full bodied. Initial infusion of hops followed by slight grapefruit and citrus notes, with a balanced bitterness.
Palate: Hops, citrus
Overall: A great Imperial Pils, would highly recommend it for a warm afternoon session beer
Overall a quality IPA. Strong citrus and earthy hoppy aromas, pouring a medium to dark colour. Medium-to-full bodied, well-balanced hops, citrus notes with a subtle bitter finish.

Aroma: Strong coffee scents, with roasted grain. Overall pleasing with slight dark chocolate notes
Appearance: Pours an espresso black colour, with a tanned creamy head which holds reasonably well
Taste: Leading coffee/espresso notes, followed by roasted malts, dark chocolate, and a slightly dry and subtle bitter finish
Palate: Above. Well balanced. Bitter beginning, dry finish.
Overall: A quality stout. If you enjoy your coffee, you will enjoy this even more than usual.
